name: fatty alcohol sulfate production, petrochemical | fatty alcohol sulfate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5931/documentation

fatty alcohol sulfate production, petrochemical, GLO 1995;This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of fatty alcohol sulfate (FAS) from fatty alcohol produced from petrochemical. ;The dataset consider the production of FAS with short chain lengths of C12-C15. Material and energy inputs are from literature sources. Transport and infrastructure are estimated from a large chemical plant.;General flow diagram for the production of FAS:;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of fatty alcohol from petrochemical, SO3, and NaOH at the factory gate.

This activity ends with 1 kg of fatty alcohol sulfate.The dataset includes material and energy input, transport, infrastructure, production of waste (landfill) and emissions to air and water. The dataset doesn't include water consumption.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2023:Manufacture of soap and detergents, cleaning and polishing preparations, pe

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data based on the European fatty alcohol sulfonate production
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Average technology for the production of FAS with short chain lengh (C12-C15), representing typical European production mix in the mid 90s;Fatty alcohols are the starting product for manufacturing fatty alcohol sulfate (FAS). They can be produced oleochemically or petrochemically. FAS are obtained by sulphonation of the alcohols. A thin film of alcohol is brought together with a mixture of SO3 and dry air inside a vertical tube. The heat produced by the reaction is removed using coolants outside the tube. SO3 itself is produced through a catalytic oxidisation of SO2, which derives from the combustion of sulphur or as a secondary product. After sulphonation, sodium hydroxide is applied to neutralize the acid that has been formed.;Reference:;Hirsinger F., Schick K.-P., (1995) A Life-Cycle Inventory for the Production of Alcohol Suplphates in Europe. In Tenside, Surfactants, Detergents, 32 (2), pp.128-139;//Comment added during dataset update:// the petrochemical route has been designated as modern, since it has the good ability to change capacity with changes in demand compared to most oleochemical raw materials (with palm oil as an exception).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: see technology This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography RER. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: data out of ECOSOL study of European Surfactant Industry. Common translation rules used, reported in Chemical report (Althaus et al. 2003).
